entry.title: How did two broke journalists wind up with the famously unattainable bachelor billionaires?
entry.summary:
Author: tearsofjoyandsorrow

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,107Chapters: 4/17Kudos: 26

Summary: What if there were a universe where DC and Marvel were intermixed and we got to see the insane similarities of superbat and starker?In this universe, it just so happens that the Daily Bugle and the Daily Planet are sister companies working out of New York and Metropolis, respectively, and every once and a while, there are larger crossover events in which Peter Parker and Clark Kent interact. They aren't best friends by any means, but they get along quite well.Simultaneously, Bruce Wayne and Tony Stark are maintaining a strange frenemies dynamic. When the world looks like it's going to end, the two of them band together to resolve things, but outside of that, they frequently try to one-up each other with their tech, bank accounts and sexual conquests.I'm still not sure what I am doing, but someone said they would read this, so here I try!

entry.title: you give it all but i want more (and i'm waiting for you)
entry.summary:
Author: morally_gay

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,047Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 1

Summary: “I know!” he whisper-shouts into the phone, attempting to prevent his bag from falling off his shoulder as he rushes down the hall, “I just—” His sentence was cut off as he collided into something— someone, sending the stranger stumbling to the floor, the papers the man was holding flying out across the linoleum floor. “Oh jeez,” Clark mutters under his breath, “Lois, I have to go, I’ll call you back.” He doesn’t wait for her response— he’s sure she’ll be fine, if not just mildly irritated, and she’d surely fill in his interview, even if he had hell to pay for it later— before he shoves his phone into his pocket, pushing his glasses back up his nose as he kneels down to help gather up the papers, “I’m so sorry,” he apologised profusely, extending the messy pile of sheets to the stranger, “I was in a bit of a rush, I didn’t see you there and I—” He pauses, finally looking up at the other man.   or   In which Bruce Wayne adopts a fake identity and transfers universities in the most roundabout attempt at getting to know his crush, and Clark Kent just wants to befriend the new student (though breaking his nose is probably not the best start).

entry.title: will the summer end
entry.summary:
Author: Shelbanator69000

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,143Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 3

Summary: All Bruce Wayne wanted was to spend his summer vacation at his house and ignore everyone he knew, but to his dismay, he was sent to spend his summer elsewhere. A small town in Kansas called Smallville, on a farm with a boy his age and old friends of Alfred's with his only task being to have fun and make the most of it, and he tried, for the first time in a long time, he felt human, he felt alive, he felt like a kid again and, most importantly he felt love like he had never truely felt it and he couldnt get enough.

entry.title: A Shadow Of A Ghost
entry.summary:
Author: MysticRose1992

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 19,445Chapters: 6/?Kudos: 726

Summary: Danyal Al Ghul was the younger twin brother of Damian Al Ghul, and destined to be his brother’s right hand man, the ghost that whispered the secrets of others in his ear. Danyal was a dangerous foe to have, one that could look at you and know all of your secrets, one that could vanish right in front of you. So, it was both the saddest and the happiest day when Danyal Al Ghul and his guards disappeared, all thought to be dead, when he was ten.Danny Fenton was the quiet weird kid that the strange, eccentric Drs. Maddie and Jack Fenton found and adopted one day. He was deathly silent, and yet with one look from his piercing blue eyes he could silence you. Even with his weird aura around him, he managed to pull two of the only other weird kids into being his best friends. The three of them were inseparable and seemed to have developed their own silent communications.Danny is weirdly smart about certain things and yet seems to be failing his English class. Danny is forced to write an essay that just so happens to win his English class a week-long trip to Gotham. Surely nothing could go wrong with a group of teenagers from Amity Park and the two adults accompanying them in Gotham?

entry.title: World’s Greatest Detective, World’s Worst Grocery Shopper
entry.summary:
Author: oxfordcommachameleon

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,825Chapters: 2/2Kudos: 87

Summary: Outside there’s a raging storm, fat raindrops pattering on the manor’s gothic and, in Clark’s opinion, garish windows. Bad storms are nothing new for Gotham, in fact it’s the norm, but it still makes Clark uneasy, even after visiting the city every week since he and Bruce started… well he doesn’t exactly know what they started, but friends, enemies, or something else, it doesn’t matter because here he is, staring at the inside of Bruce Wayne’s stainless steel, high-tech, and definitely obscenely expensive, refrigerator. He just wanted to make some hot chocolate to calm his nerves, but his storm-related worries got replaced with shock and concern. He knows that Alfred went on vacation, but it hasn’t even been 2 weeks, and Clark never imagined it could be this bad.AKABruce doesn't know how to grocery shop, Clark is concerned and overly eager, they're both idiots in love.

entry.title: Please Notice Me, Mr. Wayne!
entry.summary:
Author: alohamoron

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,394Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 67

Summary: Clark Kent has always been obsessive. From the moment he was born, his mind latched onto things without ever realizing it was unusual. Maybe it was because he was an alien raised among humans, or maybe it was simply his nature. As a child his obsessions shifted from puzzles to chess, each one consuming him completely before giving way to the next. But now, as an adult, he has discovered a fixation unlike any before. His attention has settled on Bruce Wayne, the enigmatic billionaire of Gotham.

entry.title: Gods Don't Belong in Gotham
entry.summary:
Author: Anonymous

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 20,389Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 129

Summary: “Well?” he asked, his voice low.A pause.His eyes dragged over Clark, not with drunken lust but with something sharper.“You here to watch… or join? Might as well make it a threesome.”Clark choked on his own spit so hard he nearly doubled over, coughing. It's been 5 years since both Superman and Batman began their separate crusades. Both curious but cautious.Clark remains in Metropolis, respecting the Dark Knight's strict rule to keep metas out of Gotham. Meanwhile, Bruce is consumed with finding a balance between Batman and Bruce Wayne, determine to not repeat mistakes of the past. But it's hard to do that when he is too stubborn to accept help. Fortunately, for him Clark is just as stubborn.Their paths cross when Clark is sent to cover a gala in Gotham, stepping into the city he's barred from. What begins as a professional obligation turns into an unforgettable collision with Gotham's once reclusive billionaire. Or Clark and Bruce fall for each other slowly yet quickly.
